sentences.english: The accident of aortic cannulation is very dangerous and the mortality of this complication is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 主動脈插管意外極爲兇險，死亡率非常高。

sentences.english: They barely seem to realize that the danger hidden there, just like the ancient inaccessible palace .
sentences.chinese: 殊不知“豪門”暗藏的兇險，就像古代的深宮。

sentences.english: And you thought driving in China was treacherous.
sentences.chinese: 許你認爲在中國開車是兇險的。

sentences.english: Purus Duan knew full well that the situation was most perilous.
sentences.chinese: 段正淳明知情勢極是兇險。

sentences.english: Conclusion The key point of reducing the incidence of pernicious placenta praevia is to step down the rate of cesarean section.
sentences.chinese: 結論降低剖宮產率是減少兇險型前置胎盤發生的關鍵。
龍的血盆大口分外顯眼，顯然是一隻兇險的野獸。

sentences.english: Death-dealing waves sing meaningless ballads to the children.
sentences.chinese: 兇險波濤對這孩子們唱着舞意義的歌。

sentences.english: Tomorrow is the day when the evil become good. I am not evil.
sentences.chinese: 明日是棄惡從善的日子，我並不兇險。

sentences.english: When I looked up at Barrett's ugly face, it was grim.
sentences.chinese: 我仰頭看着巴雷特那張兇險的臉龐，那上面只有冷酷。

sentences.english: ED:I'm the world's most dangerous predator.
sentences.chinese: 我非那個世界上最兇險的侵犯者。

definition: you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
